comments: I am not a big fan of philosophy. Although it was inspiring to see how passionate Prof Walsh is about philosophy. The exams for us were all multi choice and very difficult. You must study and memorize very well before the exam. There is also a lot of extra credit offered. At the end of the class I got an A.

comments: Professor Sean is a such a good profesor I recommend not skipping class for Philosophy because then you won\'t get the in class notes and get a better understanding of the in class readings. He\'s a funny guy every time he walks in class he says "It\'s a beautiful day in the neighborhood" which I love, he made me find philosophy interesting.

comments: Amazing professor that made me realize I was in the wrong major. Very passionate about what he teaches and is very stimulating to have conversations with. Tells his family stories and relates them to class material. Very uplifting, positive professor and would absolutely love to take him again

comments: Attendance is mandatory if you want to do well. Keeps lectures interesting tho and very thoroughly covers material. Tells you exactly what will be on the tests and gives you MANY easy extra credit opportunities. Passionate, funny guy, overall an easy A.

comments: Sean is an amazing professor, I really grew as a person by taking classes with him. By being required to analyze my ethical thoughts and by looking at ethical theories, there is significant room to improve as a person.

stu_tags: SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.  PARTICIPATION MATTERS  AMAZING LECTURES
comments: Made lecture fun to go to, only fell asleep like once. The readings are super hard. If you think you can just read and then skip lecture you are wrong. He gives clear notes in class if you write down everything he says you\'ll be fine. He tends to curve exams by about 15-20 points, I uaually got extra credit on them. 3 Discussion posts weekly

stu_tags: TOUGH GRADER  LECTURE HEAVY  SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.
comments: Intro to Philosophy was an interesting class. It required 5 books and reading those books is important. Class is lecture heavy and you can\'t take notes on electronics. Tests are very important, making up most of your grade. For one test you have to learn Chinese symbols and identify them on the test. Study hard!

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (7)  Amazing lectures (5)  EXTRA CREDIT (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (3)  Inspirational (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Get ready to read (2)  Caring (2)  Participation matters (1)  Respected (1)  Hilarious (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)
comments: Sean Drysdale Walsh. A true gem. Takes his teaching responsibilities seriously. Gives detailed notes and that translates into good test scores if you study well. He\'s a Aristotelian guy and lives his life accordingly--a very virtuous man with a ton of wisdom (not just dry, lifeless knowledge). His totalitarian ban on laptops is really helpful, too.

comments: I loved taking this class with Dr. Walsh! He was very knowledgeable about Philosophy and overall I learned a lot! His lectures are pretty long, but they talk about interesting topics that helps you pay attention. He has a very strict attendance policy, but coming to class really helps. I would definitely recommend taking his class!

stu_tags: SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.  CARING  RESPECTED
comments: I confess to really enjoying this Professor. Very down to earth guy, who is there for you if you would only take advantage of it (go to his office). Another thing I particularly like about him is his totalitarian ban on laptops, smartphones, etc during his lectures. If only more professors would too! And then they wonder why no one was listening?!

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (7)  Amazing lectures (5)  EXTRA CREDIT (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (3)  Inspirational (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Get ready to read (2)  Caring (2)  Participation matters (1)  Respected (1)  Hilarious (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)
comments: I like Sean as a person and professor, but I hated his attendance policy. If you miss class, you are required to write a three page essay or you might not pass the class. It\'s not hard to write, but it\'s a waste of time. Otherwise, I found his class very easy. He clearly articulates what will be on the test, so there are no surprises.

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (7)  Amazing lectures (5)  EXTRA CREDIT (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (3)  Inspirational (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Get ready to read (2)  Caring (2)  Participation matters (1)  Respected (1)  Hilarious (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)
comments: Dr. Walsh is very knowledgable in his subject matter. He does make you think. Dr. Walsh does rely heavily on Moodle forums to complement his class. This can be helpful and interesting, but for the most part it feels like busy-work. Dr. Walsh\'s attendance policy is very strict, so if you plan to miss even a few classes, look for another professor.

comments: Great teacher! Made the class very interesting and fun to take. Attendance is mandatory for credit, but you don\'t have to pay attention to do well in the class. Required to post quotes from the books, however the books never helped on the tests. Overall a great teacher and an easy class.

comments: I am very pleased to say that Doctor Walsh is one of the finest professors at UMD. He makes the subject fun, isn\'t too serious and knows his stuff. Has become somewhat of a father figure to me. I love him. One time he slept thru the first half hour of class but nontheless, take all the classes with him as you can.

comments: The books don\'t help any even if you read them, but were required to post quotes online. Go to class and take notes on everything, usually uses random facts on tests.

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (7)  Amazing lectures (5)  EXTRA CREDIT (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (3)  Inspirational (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Get ready to read (2)  Caring (2)  Participation matters (1)  Respected (1)  Hilarious (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)
comments: Amazing professor. I had sean Walsh for my intro to philosophy course. I found him to be helpful, encouraging, enthusiastic. The main outline for the course was read the reading assignment, go to the lecture to better understand that reading assignment, and post the your comments on moodle. Tests are not hard just use good reasoning (M.C and T/F)

comments: I\'ve had two classes with him and plan to take more. He is possibly my favorie professor. His class is a lot of work but not difficult. If you go to class, take notes do the moodle posts, and study for the tests you\'re pretty much golden. I\'m not the best at tests and I do well on his.
